Staff, Guides & Management: Heartfelt thank you to Lt Cdr Vishnu, whose efforts and thoughtful arrangements ensured the children had an exceptionally memorable experience.
Deeply grateful to Cmde Muthu Krishnan, whose support helped make this outing a remarkable success.
Tickets, Entry & Pricing: Entry fee is 150₹ and worth it
Suitability for specific audiences: appeals to visitors from all walks of life, regardless of their interest in aviation
Great museum if you are an aviation buff
Worth visiting with kids and elders!
Visited with 20 children from a tuition centre - most of whom had never seen an aircraft up close.
Historical or Cultural Significance: Vintage planes on display, though decommissioned
The museum also features a dedicated section highlighting the Indian Navy's role in Goa’s liberation, offering a glimpse into a significant chapter of Indian history.
Stories are displayed from pre-independence era
Inspiring tribute to the rich history and legacy of the Indian Navy.
Thoughtful displays teach about courage, discipline, and service to the nation.
Showcasing the glorious history of Indian Naval Aviation.
The only one of its kind in Asia.
Understand the history of the Indian Navy firsthand.
Adventure & Activities: On display there are Fighters, Trainer Aircrafts, Sea planes and Choppers, all belonging to INS.
An Engine room with jet engines on display
A video about our Naval forces and their missions
Showcases once-operational helicopters and aircraft used by the Indian Navy.
Visitors can even step inside some of the aircraft for a hands-on experience.
Aircraft were so well maintained with detailed placards.
The indoor information floor was so engrossing!
Children got the rare opportunity to step inside a real aircraft and sit in the cockpit.
Outdoor exhibit featuring legendary aircraft like the Hawker Sea Hawk, Westland Sea King, and the mighty Sea Harrier.
The Ka-25 and Alizé aircraft are also on display.
Indoor gallery exploring the history of naval aviation.
Display of pilot uniforms, weapons, historic photographs, and engine models.
Engine Bay featuring rare aviation engines from the World War era.
Understand the workings of the Indian Navy firsthand.
Value for Time & Money: time spent exploring the exhibits is undeniably rewarding
Entry fee is 150₹ and worth it
It was worth every minute spent.
Local Tips & Insider Advice: A visit to Goa is incomplete without stopping by this remarkable museum.
Located in Bogmalo, near Vasco da Gama.
Proximity to Bogmalo Beach makes for a perfect day trip.
Emotional Tone / Vibe: Excitement and awe of the children were truly heartwarming.
A moment of pure joy and wonder for the children.
Visit left a lasting impression on their young minds and sparked a sense of pride and curiosity.
One of the most amazing days in these children's lives.
Unforgettable experience that fuels the passion for aviation and India’s rich military heritage.
